name: Surveiller X/Twitter pour les publications de recrutement avec Apify, filtrage AI et alertes Telegram
description:
Récupérez automatiquement X (Twitter) pour des publications recrutant des rôles spécifiques (par exemple, ingénieurs en automatisation, monteurs vidéo, graphistes), filtrez l'intention de recrutement réelle avec l'IA, dédupliquez dans Google Sheets et alertez via Telegram.

## Ce que cela fait

- Récupère les publications récentes X/Twitter pour plusieurs mots-clés de rôle via Apify.

- Normalise chaque publication (texte, auteur, liens, emplacement).

- Utilise un agent IA pour ne conserver que les publications où l'auteur recrute (pas d'auto-promotion).

- Vérifie Google Sheets pour les doublons par URL avant de sauvegarder.

- Écrit les publications qualifiées dans une feuille et envoie une notification Telegram.

Nous utilisons les rôles d'automatisation n8n comme exemple ici


## Comment cela fonctionne (Étape par Étape)

1. **Déclencheur de Planification** – S'exécute à intervalles réguliers (actuellement toutes les 12 heures).

2. **Scraper X/Twitter** – Le scraper de tweets Apify récupère jusqu'à 50 dernières publications pour des mots-clés comme :
développeur n8n, à la recherche de n8n, expert n8n, embaucher l'automatisation IA, à la recherche de l'automatisation IA.

3. **Normaliser les Champs** – Définir les mappages de nœuds sur : url, texte, author.userName, author.url, author.location.

4. **Filtre IA & Vérification de Dédoublonnage**

- Accepter uniquement les publications de recrutement claires pour les rôles d'automatisation n8n/IA (rejeter l'auto-promotion).
- Interroge Google Sheets pour voir si l'url existe déjà ; les doublons sont supprimés.

5. **Passerelle** – SI le nœud passe, seules les sorties IA non vides.

6. **Analyser JSON en toute sécurité** – Le nœud de code extrait/valide le JSON de la sortie IA.

7. **Sauvegarder dans Google Sheets** – Ajoute/met à jour une ligne (correspondant à l'url).

8. **Alerte Telegram** – Envoie un message avec l'URL du tweet, l'auteur, l'emplacement et le texte.

## Pour qui c'est

Freelancers, agences et chercheurs d'emploi qui souhaitent un radar constant des véritables publications de recrutement pour leurs rôles cibles.

## Idées de Personnalisation

Échanger des mots-clés pour suivre d'autres rôles (monteurs vidéo, designers, rédacteurs, etc.).

Ajouter des notifications Slack/Discord.

Étendre les règles de l'IA (par exemple, différentes géographies ou portées de rôle).

Traiter la feuille comme un mini-CRM (statut, date de contact, notes).

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet1

parameters.jsonBody:
{
    "maxItems": 50,
    "searchTerms": [
      "n8n developer", 
      "looking for n8n",
      "n8n expert",
      "hire AI automation", 
      "looking for AI automation"
    ],
    "sort": "Latest"
}

parameters.text: =This is the text that you have to check  {{ $json.text }}{{ $json.url }}{{ $json.author }}

options.systemMessage:
=<goal> You are **Hiring Post Classifier & Extractor**. Read short social posts (Twitter/Threads), plus author bio and any link-preview text, and return **only** posts where the **author is hiring an n8n/AI automation engineer** in allowed geographies. Deduplicate against Google Sheets by `url`. If non-passing or duplicate → **output nothing**. </goal>

<format_rules>

Input (exact shape):

{
  "url": "https://twitter.com/... or https://www.threads.net/...",
  "text": "raw post text",
  "author": {
    "userName": "handle or display name",
    "url": "author profile url",
    "location": "free-text location from bio (optional)"
  }
}


Output: strict JSON (see <output>) for passing, non-duplicate posts; otherwise no output (empty response).

No extra fields, arrays, prose, or explanations.
</format_rules>


<decision_rules>

Reduce tokens where ever possible

Hire-only by the author (no replies/retweets unless the author restates as the hirer).
Accept only if text clearly signals an open n8n/AI automation engineer role.
Strong hire cues (any): hiring, we’re hiring, opening, role, position, join our team, bring on an automation engineer, seeking n8n engineer, need an AI automation engineer, apply, send your portfolio/resume, email to, link to job.
Helpful (not required): full-time, part-time, contract, paid, salary, compensation.
Role scope (accept): n8n engineer, AI automation engineer, workflow automation engineer, automation developer (explicit n8n/AI automation duties), no-code/low-code automation engineer (with n8n/AI explicitly mentioned).
Exclude: generic software roles without automation focus; RPA-only if n8n/AI automation isn’t explicit; “consultant available” language (see self-promo).

Exclude self-promotion / service ads / bait.
Reject if the author markets themselves/services (e.g., “hire me,” “available for projects,” “my rates,” “portfolio/reel,” “DMs open to hire me,” “book me,” “client work,” “commissions,” “services”).
If the bio indicates the author is a freelancer for hire and the post is ambiguous → treat as self-promo → exclude.

Deduplication (Google Sheets).
After passing 1–3, query the sheet for the url. If found → no output. If not found → output JSON.
</decision_rules>

<tools_and_usage>
<google_sheets access="read-only">

method: find(url) → returns a match if the post url already exists
</google_sheets>
</tools_and_usage>

<planning_guidance>

Confirm author hiring signal for an n8n/AI automation engineer (not self-promo; not a reply/retweet unless restated).

Apply geo rules using post text, bio location, and link-preview text.

If pass, dedupe via Google Sheets on url.

If unique, emit strict JSON with minimal pass-through fields.
</planning_guidance>

<output> For passing, non-duplicate posts, return **only**: ```json { "url": "{{ $json.url }}", "text": "{{ $json.text }}", "username": "{{ $json.author.userName }}", "profile_url": "{{ $json.author.url }}", "location": "{{ $json.author.location }}" } ``` Otherwise, **return nothing**. </output>

nodes.name: Get row(s) in sheet in Google Sheets1

parameters.content:
Automatically scrape X (Twitter) for posts hiring specific roles (e.g., automation engineers, video editors, graphic designers), filter true hiring intent with AI, deduplicate in Google Sheets, and alert via Telegram.

## What it does

- Pulls recent X/Twitter posts for multiple role keywords via Apify.

- Normalizes each post (text, author, links, location).

- Uses an AI Agent to keep only posts where the author is hiring (not self-promo).

- Checks Google Sheets for duplicates by URL before saving.

- Writes qualified posts to a sheet and sends a Telegram notification.

We are using n8n automation roles as the example here


## How it works (Step by Step)

1. **Schedule Trigger** – Runs on an interval (currently every 12 hours).

2. **Scrape X/Twitter** – Apify tweet-scraper fetches up to 50 latest posts for keywords like:
n8n developer, looking for n8n, n8n expert, hire AI automation, looking for AI automation.

3. **Normalize Fields** – Set node maps to: url, text, author.userName, author.url, author.location.

4. **AI Filter & Dedupe Check**

- Accept only clear hiring posts for n8n/AI automation roles (reject self-promotion).
- Queries Google Sheets to see if url already exists; duplicates are dropped.

5. **Gate** – IF node passes only non-empty AI outputs.

6. **Parse JSON Safely** – Code node extracts/validates JSON from the AI output.

7. **Save to Google Sheets** – Appends/updates a row (matching on url).

8. **Telegram Alert** – Sends a message with the tweet URL, author, location, and text.

## Who it’s for

Freelancers, agencies, and job seekers who want a steady radar of real hiring posts for their target roles.

## Customization Ideas

Swap keywords to track other roles (video editors, designers, copywriters, etc.).

Add Slack/Discord notifications.

Extend the AI rules (e.g., different geographies or role scopes).

Treat the sheet as a mini-CRM (status, outreach date, notes).

# Looking for tailored workflows? Book through my Reddit or website—and follow for future templates.
## Reddit: https://www.reddit.com/user/designbyaze/
## Website: https://hushtech.io/

## 1. Replace the API keys in each Https node
## 2. Add the specified role in the json part.
## 3, The apify actor used: https://apify.com/apidojo/tweet-scraper

main.node: Append or update row in sheet1

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
